name: castor bean production | castor bean | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21473/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Castor Beans during May-October, 2016 at a farm located in village Lilapar, District is Rajkot of Gujarat. The farm has a yield of 647 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 15-June, 2016 and harvesting date is 10-October, 2016. Mineral NP fertilizer input is 119-57.50 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 9,000 kg of manure from cattle dung. Pesticides used has active ingredient of Imidacloprid 53.4 g/ha and Aldrin 120g/ha. Machinery is used for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 64 kg/ha using plough 43 kg/ha for harvesting and 11.65 kg/ha is used for other work process like transport, tractor and trailer.   

This activity starts about three weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in mid-May and sowing of seeds started about five weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 4 months.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Castor Beans from the Castor bean plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 17-May, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 10-October, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 120 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: village Lilapar, District is Rajkot of Gujarat
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Castor Beans follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'castor bean' is calculated to be circa 2.74E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.48E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of castor bean is calculated to be circa 2.68E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'cyclic N-compound', 'pesticide, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.36E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
